decks.notes: This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck, classified as Aggro - Bazaar Aggro, focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing powerful creatures like Vengevine, Hollow One, Blazing Rootwalla, and Master of Death. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void, Mental Misstep, and Mindbreak Trap to slow down opponents. It utilizes the unique ability of Bazaar of Baghdad to enable graveyard-based strategies, allowing for powerful interactions with cards like Squee, Goblin Nabob and Noxious Revival. Additionally, it includes a strong suite of Force spells (Force of Will, Force of Negation, Force of Vigor) to protect its game plan.

This is an Aggro - Fish deck with Lurrus of the Dream-Den as the companion. The key concept of this deck is to maintain a low curve and apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It aims to utilize efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Questing Druid while using disruption spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to control the board. The deck also includes card advantage through spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time, as well as powerful mana acceleration with Moxen and fetch lands.

The key concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through cards like Tolarian Academy, Grim Monolith, and Mishra's Workshop, while also utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Coveted Jewel to draw a significant number of cards. This deck aims to assemble a combination of cards, such as Time Vault and Voltaic Key or Mishra's Workshop and The One Ring, to create a powerful win condition. The deck also includes disruption through cards like Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. Overall, the key concept is to generate and leverage large amounts of mana for a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on using control elements and engineering tactics to dominate the game. It heavily relies on artifacts and fast mana to generate quick advantage. The key concept of this deck is to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain control through cards like Force of Will, Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, and Spell Pierce. It also has a strong emphasis on artifact synergy with cards like Urza's Saga, Goblin Engineer, and Manifold Key. The goal is to outmaneuver opponents and win through card advantage, disruption, and strategic plays.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using counterspells and removal spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes powerful artifacts like Time Vault, Mana Crypt, and the Moxen to ramp up its resources and gain an advantage. It also includes powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to search for key cards or answers to specific threats. The deck aims to stay in control of the game by countering or removing threats while gradually building up its own board presence and card advantage.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 combo deck revolves around the Dredge mechanic. The goal is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Ichorid, Stinkweed Imp, and Golgari Thug, while utilizing cards such as Serum Powder and Bazaar of Baghdad to dig through the deck. Once the graveyard is packed, the deck can bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Hollow One for free, triggering their abilities and overwhelming the opponent. Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection, while Silversmote Ghoul and Grief offer additional value and disruption.
